definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: Please stand for the national anthem.
The whole audience rose as the Chancellor and the Ambassador walked onto the rostrum and took their seats.
sentences.chinese: 全体听众起立，彭定康校长和刘大使走上主席台落座。

sentences.english: At his bidding, the delegates rose and sang the national anthem.
sentences.chinese: 按照他的要求，代表们起立唱国歌。

sentences.english: The audience rose to the dancers.
sentences.chinese: 观众起立向舞蹈演员热烈鼓掌。

sentences.english: Try push-ups, abdominal crunches and leg squats.
sentences.chinese: 试试俯卧撑，仰卧起坐和下蹲起立。

sentences.english: They all stood up when the judges entered the courtroom.
sentences.chinese: 当法官进入法庭进他们全部起立。

sentences.english: He received 28 standing ovations from Democrats and Republicans alike in Congress.
sentences.chinese: 因此他受到议会中28个民主党和共和党的起立致敬。

sentences.english: Stand strong east wind, Cancan pear bloom.
sentences.chinese: 强起立东风，惨惨梨花谢。

sentences.english: The knights rose from the banquet table to pledge the king.
sentences.chinese: 众武士从宴席上起立，举杯祝国王健康。

sentences.english: Now let's bounce the basketball more and more quickly.
sentences.chinese: 学生起立做拍球动作跟着老师的节奏越来越快。

sentences.english: We all stood for his coming.
sentences.chinese: 我们对他的到来，起立表示敬意。

sentences.english: All the representatives stood up to sing the national anthem.
sentences.chinese: 代表们全体起立，共唱国歌。

sentences.english: My roommates stood up and saw me off solemnly, as if I were heading for the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 室友们全体起立，庄重地送我，像赴战场。

sentences.english: When the wonderful concert was over, all the audience stood up and clapped their hands.
sentences.chinese: 精彩的音乐会结束时，全体观众起立鼓掌。

sentences.english: I was gonna ask her to stand, but I see she already has.
sentences.chinese: 我刚想让她起立但是看见她已经起来了。

sentences.english: At the opening ceremony, we all stood for the national song.
sentences.chinese: 开幕式奏国歌时，我们全都起立。

definition: to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
to send one's greetings/to send best regards/to devote attention to
to raise a hand/to put up one's hand (as signal)
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
to seat (sb in a restaurant etc)/to take one's seat
